description: Starts or continues a non-streaming Amazon Q Business conversation.

parameters.name: applicationId
parameters.description: The identifier of the Amazon Q Business application linked to the Amazon Q Business conversation.

parameters.name: userGroups
parameters.description: The group names that a user associated with the chat input belongs to. (string) ---

parameters.name: attachments
parameters.description: A list of files uploaded directly during chat. You can upload a maximum of 5 files of upto 10 MB each. (dict) --- This is either a file directly uploaded into a web experience chat or a reference to an existing attachment that is part of a web experience chat. data (bytes) --- The contents of the attachment. name (string) --- The filename of the attachment. copyFrom (dict) --- A reference to an existing attachment. conversation (dict) --- A reference to an attachment in an existing conversation. The unique identifier of the Amazon Q Business conversation. The unique identifier of the Amazon Q Business attachment.

nested_params.name: copyFrom
nested_params.description: A reference to an existing attachment.

nested_params.name: conversation
nested_params.description: A reference to an attachment in an existing conversation.

nested_params.name: conversationId
nested_params.description: The unique identifier of the Amazon Q Business conversation.

nested_params.name: attachmentId
nested_params.description: The unique identifier of the Amazon Q Business attachment.

parameters.name: actionExecution
parameters.description: A request from an end user to perform an Amazon Q Business plugin action. The identifier of the plugin the action is attached to. A mapping of field names to the field values in input that an end user provides to Amazon Q Business requests to perform their plugin action. (string) --- (dict) --- A user input field in an plugin action execution payload. The content of a user input field in an plugin action execution payload. A string used to retain information about the hierarchical contexts within an action execution event payload.

nested_params.name: pluginId
nested_params.description: The identifier of the plugin the action is attached to.

nested_params.name: payload
nested_params.description: A mapping of field names to the field values in input that an end user provides to Amazon Q Business requests to perform their plugin action.

nested_params.name: value
nested_params.description: The content of a user input field in an plugin action execution payload.

nested_params.name: payloadFieldNameSeparator
nested_params.description: A string used to retain information about the hierarchical contexts within an action execution event payload.

parameters.name: authChallengeResponse
parameters.description: An authentication verification event response by a third party authentication server to Amazon Q Business. The mapping of key-value pairs in an authentication challenge response. (string) --- (string) ---

nested_params.name: responseMap
nested_params.description: The mapping of key-value pairs in an authentication challenge response.

parameters.name: attributeFilter
parameters.description: Enables filtering of Amazon Q Business web experience responses based on document attributes or metadata fields. andAllFilters (list) --- Performs a logical AND operation on all supplied filters. (dict) --- Enables filtering of responses based on document attributes or metadata fields. orAllFilters (list) --- Performs a logical OR operation on all supplied filters. notFilter (dict) --- Performs a logical NOT operation on all supplied filters. equalsTo (dict) --- Performs an equals operation on two document attributes or metadata fields. Supported for the following document attribute value types: dateValue, longValue, stringListValue and stringValue. The identifier for the attribute. The value of the attribute. stringValue (string) --- A string. stringListValue (list) --- A list of strings. (string) --- longValue (integer) --- A long integer value. dateValue (datetime) --- A date expressed as an ISO 8601 string. It's important for the time zone to be included in the ISO 8601 date-time format. For example, 2012-03-25T12:30:10+01:00 is the ISO 8601 date-time format for March 25th 2012 at 12:30PM (plus 10 seconds) in Central European Time. containsAll (dict) --- Returns true when a document contains all the specified document attributes or metadata fields. Supported for the following document attribute value types: stringListValue. containsAny (dict) --- Returns true when a document contains any of the specified document attributes or metadata fields. greaterThan (dict) --- Performs a greater than operation on two document attributes or metadata fields. Supported for the following document attribute value types: dateValue and longValue. greaterThanOrEquals (dict) --- Performs a greater or equals than operation on two document attributes or metadata fields. lessThan (dict) --- Performs a less than operation on two document attributes or metadata fields. lessThanOrEquals (dict) --- Performs a less than or equals operation on two document attributes or metadata fields.Supported for the following document attribute value type: dateValue and longValue. For example, 2012-03-25T12:30:10+01:00 is the ISO 8601 date-time format for March 25th 2012 at 12:30PM (plus 10 seconds) in Central European Time.

nested_params.name: andAllFilters
nested_params.description: Performs a logical AND operation on all supplied filters.

nested_params.name: orAllFilters
nested_params.description: Performs a logical OR operation on all supplied filters.

nested_params.name: notFilter
nested_params.description: Performs a logical NOT operation on all supplied filters.

nested_params.name: equalsTo
nested_params.description: Performs an equals operation on two document attributes or metadata fields. Supported for the following document attribute value types: dateValue, longValue, stringListValue and stringValue.

nested_params.name: dateValue
nested_params.description: A date expressed as an ISO 8601 string. It's important for the time zone to be included in the ISO 8601 date-time format. For example, 2012-03-25T12:30:10+01:00 is the ISO 8601 date-time format for March 25th 2012 at 12:30PM (plus 10 seconds) in Central European Time.

parameters.name: chatMode
parameters.description: The chatMode parameter determines the chat modes available to Amazon Q Business users: RETRIEVAL_MODE - If you choose this mode, Amazon Q generates responses solely from the data sources connected and indexed by the application. If an answer is not found in the data sources or there are no data sources available, Amazon Q will respond with a 'No Answer Found' message, unless LLM knowledge has been enabled. In that case, Amazon Q will generate a response from the LLM knowledge CREATOR_MODE - By selecting this mode, you can choose to generate responses only from the LLM knowledge. You can also attach files and have Amazon Q generate a response based on the data in those files. If the attached files do not contain an answer for the query, Amazon Q will automatically fall back to generating a response from the LLM knowledge. PLUGIN_MODE - By selecting this mode, users can choose to use plugins in chat to get their responses. For more information, see Admin controls and guardrails, Plugins, and Response sources.

parameters.name: chatModeConfiguration
parameters.description: The chat mode configuration for an Amazon Q Business application. pluginConfiguration (dict) --- Configuration information required to invoke chat in PLUGIN_MODE. The identifier of the plugin you want to use.

nested_params.name: pluginConfiguration
nested_params.description: Configuration information required to invoke chat in PLUGIN_MODE.

nested_params.name: pluginId
nested_params.description: The identifier of the plugin you want to use.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: A token that you provide to identify a chat request. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

nested_items.name: conversationId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the Amazon Q Business conversation.

nested_items.name: systemMessage
nested_items.description: An AI-generated message in a conversation.

nested_items.name: systemMessageId
nested_items.description: The identifier of an Amazon Q Business AI generated message within the conversation.

nested_items.name: userMessageId
nested_items.description: The identifier of an Amazon Q Business end user text input message within the conversation.

nested_items.name: actionReview
nested_items.description: A request from Amazon Q Business to the end user for information Amazon Q Business needs to successfully complete a requested plugin action.

nested_items.name: pluginId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the plugin associated with the action review.

nested_items.name: pluginType
nested_items.description: The type of plugin.

nested_items.name: displayName
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: displayName
nested_items.description: The name of the field.

nested_items.name: displayOrder
nested_items.description: The display order of fields in a payload.

nested_items.name: displayDescription
nested_items.description: The field level description of each action review input field. This could be an explanation of the field. In the Amazon Q Business web experience, these descriptions could be used to display as tool tips to help users understand the field.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of field.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The field value.

nested_items.name: allowedValues
nested_items.description: Information about the field values that an end user can use to provide to Amazon Q Business for Amazon Q Business to perform the requested plugin action.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The field value.

nested_items.name: displayValue
nested_items.description: The name of the field.

nested_items.name: allowedFormat
nested_items.description: The expected data format for the action review input field value. For example, in PTO request, from and to would be of datetime allowed format.

nested_items.name: arrayItemJsonSchema
nested_items.description: Use to create a custom form with array fields (fields with nested objects inside an array).

nested_items.name: required
nested_items.description: Information about whether the field is required.

nested_items.name: payloadFieldNameSeparator
nested_items.description: A string used to retain information about the hierarchical contexts within an action review payload.

nested_items.name: authChallengeRequest
nested_items.description: An authentication verification event activated by an end user request to use a custom plugin.

nested_items.name: authorizationUrl
nested_items.description: The URL sent by Amazon Q Business to the third party authentication server to authenticate a custom plugin user through an OAuth protocol.

nested_items.name: sourceAttributions
nested_items.description: The source documents used to generate the conversation response.

nested_items.name: title
nested_items.description: The title of the document which is the source for the Amazon Q Business generated response.

nested_items.name: snippet
nested_items.description: The content extract from the document on which the generated response is based.

nested_items.name: url
nested_items.description: The URL of the document which is the source for the Amazon Q Business generated response.

nested_items.name: citationNumber
nested_items.description: The number attached to a citation in an Amazon Q Business generated response.

nested_items.name: updatedAt
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp when the Amazon Q Business application was last updated.

nested_items.name: textMessageSegments
nested_items.description: A text extract from a source document that is used for source attribution.

nested_items.name: beginOffset
nested_items.description: The zero-based location in the response string where the source attribution starts.

nested_items.name: endOffset
nested_items.description: The zero-based location in the response string where the source attribution ends.

nested_items.name: snippetExcerpt
nested_items.description: The relevant text excerpt from a source that was used to generate a citation text segment in an Amazon Q Business chat response.

nested_items.name: text
nested_items.description: The relevant text excerpt from a source that was used to generate a citation text segment in an Amazon Q chat response.

nested_items.name: mediaId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the media object associated with the text segment in the source attribution.

nested_items.name: mediaMimeType
nested_items.description: The MIME type (image/png) of the media object associated with the text segment in the source attribution.

nested_items.name: sourceDetails
nested_items.description: Source information for a segment of extracted text, including its media type.

nested_items.name: imageSourceDetails
nested_items.description: Details specific to image content within the source.

nested_items.name: mediaId
nested_items.description: Unique identifier for the image file.

nested_items.name: mediaMimeType
nested_items.description: The MIME type of the image file.

nested_items.name: audioSourceDetails
nested_items.description: Details specific to audio content within the source.

nested_items.name: mediaId
nested_items.description: Unique identifier for the audio media file.

nested_items.name: mediaMimeType
nested_items.description: The MIME type of the audio file (e.g., audio/mp3, audio/wav).

nested_items.name: startTimeMilliseconds
nested_items.description: The starting timestamp in milliseconds for the relevant audio segment.

nested_items.name: endTimeMilliseconds
nested_items.description: The ending timestamp in milliseconds for the relevant audio segment.

nested_items.name: audioExtractionType
nested_items.description: The type of audio extraction performed on the content.

nested_items.name: videoSourceDetails
nested_items.description: Details specific to video content within the source.

nested_items.name: mediaId
nested_items.description: Unique identifier for the video media file.

nested_items.name: mediaMimeType
nested_items.description: The MIME type of the video file (e.g., video/mp4, video/avi).

nested_items.name: startTimeMilliseconds
nested_items.description: The starting timestamp in milliseconds for the relevant video segment.

nested_items.name: endTimeMilliseconds
nested_items.description: The ending timestamp in milliseconds for the relevant video segment.

nested_items.name: videoExtractionType
nested_items.description: The type of video extraction performed on the content.

nested_items.name: failedAttachments
nested_items.description: A list of files which failed to upload during chat.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of a file uploaded during chat.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of a file uploaded during chat.

nested_items.name: errorMessage
nested_items.description: The message explaining the Amazon Q Business request error.

nested_items.name: errorCode
nested_items.description: The code associated with the Amazon Q Business request error.

nested_items.name: attachmentId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the Amazon Q Business attachment.

nested_items.name: conversationId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the Amazon Q Business conversation.
